intro: Calochortus persistens, commonly known as the persistent mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes a variety of flowering plants commonly referred to as mariposa lilies. This species is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped blooms that range in color from white to pink and purple. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Calochortus persistens is often found in coastal and inland areas, particularly in California and Oregon.
